David Jolly: s work as a lobbyist for Free Enterprise Nation, a pro-business, anti-regulation advocacy group, is mentioned as evidence that he lobbied on a plan to turn Medicare into a voucher program.
A Nov: 2009 lobbying disclosure form shows that Jolly worked on behalf of Free Enterprise Nation on "Health Care reform, Social Security Reform, Paycheck Fairness Act and other labor related issues and initiatives; Taxpayer protection, and Small business."
The Ryan plan: which proposed replacing Medicare with a government payment to beneficiaries to buy private insurance, is mentioned as the plan in question.
PolitiFact: s assessment that the Ryan version of Medicare was mostly considered a voucher system is mentioned as additional evidence to support the claim.
